title: Not linked to libcudart.so.9.1 in conda installation.
body_html:
Hi, pytorch developers

Thank you for developing one of the greatest deep learning framework.

I found the following error, after conda installation.

conda install pytorch torchvision cuda91 -c pytorch

And then, I run an easy code,

Traceback (most recent call last):
    import torch
  File "/home/kono/miniconda/envs/test/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 56, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: libcudart.so.8.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

There is libcudart-fc1f7f84.so.9.1 in lib directory, but it is not linked.

  • conda information
{
  "arch": "x86_64",
  "auth": null,
  "build": "py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2",
  "build_number": 2,
  "channel": "https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64",
  "depends": [
    "cffi",
    "mkl >=2018",
    "numpy >=1.11",
    "python >=3.6,<3.7.0a0"
  ],
 "features": "cuda91",
  "files": [
      ...
   ],
  "fn": "pytorch-0.3.1-py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2.tar.bz2",
  "has_prefix": false,
  "license": "BSD 3-Clause",
  "license_family": "BSD",
  "link": {
    "source": "/home/kono/miniconda/pkgs/pytorch-0.3.1-py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2",
    "type": 1
  },
  "md5": "c957d7b9cd70414ccae81b3db8363d86",
  "name": "pytorch",
  "noarch": null,
  "platform": "linux",
  "preferred_env": null,
  "priority": 0,
  "requires": [],
  "schannel": "pytorch",
  "size": 498099284,
  "subdir": "linux-64",
  "timestamp": 1518246118790,
  "url": "https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64/pytorch-0.3.1-py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2.tar.bz2",
  "version": "0.3.1",
  "with_features_depends": {}
}
  • check libraries

	linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffc226b0000)

body_text:
Hi, pytorch developers
Thank you for developing one of the greatest deep learning framework.
I found the following error, after conda installation.
conda install pytorch torchvision cuda91 -c pytorch

And then,  I run  an easy code,
Traceback (most recent call last):
    import torch
  File "/home/kono/miniconda/envs/test/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 56, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: libcudart.so.8.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

There is libcudart-fc1f7f84.so.9.1 in lib directory, but it is not linked.

conda information

  "arch": "x86_64",

body:
Hi, pytorch developers

Thank you for developing one of the greatest deep learning framework.

I found the following error, after conda installation. 
```
conda install pytorch torchvision cuda91 -c pytorch
```
And then,  I run  an easy code,
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
    import torch
  File "/home/kono/miniconda/envs/test/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 56, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: libcudart.so.8.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
There is libcudart-fc1f7f84.so.9.1 in lib directory, but it is not linked.

* conda information

```pytorch-0.3.1-py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2.json  
{
  "arch": "x86_64",
  "auth": null,
  "build": "py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2",
  "build_number": 2,
  "channel": "https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64",
  "depends": [
    "cffi",
    "mkl >=2018",
    "numpy >=1.11",
    "python >=3.6,<3.7.0a0"
  ],
 "features": "cuda91",

      ...

  "md5": "c957d7b9cd70414ccae81b3db8363d86",
  "name": "pytorch",

  "platform": "linux",
  "preferred_env": null,
  "priority": 0,

  "url": "https://conda.anaconda.org/pytorch/linux-64/pytorch-0.3.1-py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2.tar.bz2",
  "version": "0.3.1",
  "with_features_depends": {}
}
```
* check libraries
